etymologies: Old English, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch and German west, from an Indo-European root shared by Greek hesperos, Latin vesper ‘evening’

definitions: the direction toward the point of the horizon where the sun sets at the equinoxes, on the left-hand side of a person facing north, or the part of the horizon lying in this direction

examples.text: the evening sun glowed from the west
a patrol aimed to create a diversion to the west of the city

shortDefinitions: direction towards point of horizon where sun sets at equinoxes, on left-hand side of person

definitions: the compass point corresponding to west.
the western part of the world or of a specified country, region, or town

examples.text: it will become windy in the west

shortDefinitions: western part of world or of specified country

definitions: Europe and its culture seen in contrast to other civilizations

examples.text: Aboriginal religion is closer to the Orient than the West

shortDefinitions: Europe and North America seen in contrast

definitions: the non-Communist states of Europe and North America, contrasted with the former Communist states of eastern Europe

examples.text: Mr. Yeltsin was seen by the West as the driving force behind market reforms

shortDefinitions: non-Communist states of Europe and North America

definitions: the western part of the United States, especially the states west of the Mississippi.
the player sitting to the right of North and partnering East

examples.text: West butts in with a bid of three spades

shortDefinitions: player sitting to right of North and partnering East

definitions: lying toward, near, or facing the west
shortDefinitions: lying towards, near, or facing west

definitions: (of a wind) blowing from the west

examples.text: the formation is caused by the prevalent west winds

definitions: of or denoting the western part of a specified area, city, or country or its inhabitants
shortDefinitions: of western part of specified area

examples.text: he faced west and watched the sunset
the accident happened a mile west of Bowes
